workers okay active workers they forage on a known path and a neighboring path so
they do what's called a neighborhood search they know their path they know the length of it and they try a neighboring
path and they check the length of that and they see if which one's better and if it's better they move to that
Scouts on the other hand use a random path so this is a combination algorithm this
is one where you're using a combination of neighborhood search and random search
so we get some flexibility there and then finally there are inactive workers and inactive workers have a very
interesting role they basically take their um their starting point from the
best path found from other bees and then they get rotated in
